New Direction.note: New Direction is funded by three primary donors: two presidentially-named funds, and Dime PAC.

Kennedy Fund.note: In addition to unions and gaming, Kennedy gets its donations from a PAC named Justice for All.

Truman Fund.note: Like the Kennedy Fund, the Truman Fund gets most of its donations from unions, including the service industry, teachers, and state employees.

Dime PAC.note: Dime PAC is organized by the Washington State Labor Council.

Justice For All.note: Justice For All is listed for donor purposes under as "Washington State Association for Justice," and its top donors are actually individuals.

Working Families.note: Working Families has spent $337,000 (so far) opposing State Sen. Mark Millet (D-Issaquah). But its funding comes entirely from another PAC, the vaguely-named Leadership Council.

The Leadership Council.note: The Leadership Council, in turn, is funded by the Republican State Leadership Committee (which is itself funded by the US Chamber of Commerce) and Strat PAC.

Republican State Leadership Committee.note: The US Chamber does not disclose donors to its 501(c)6 non-profit, which places it in the category of "dark money," so the trail ends here.

Strat PAC.note: The top donors to STRAT PAC are three debt collection companies.
